title: Olivia Munn and Sophia Bush stun at Forbes Under 30 Summit in Detroit as they discuss women's issues
text:
It was a day to celebrate the best examples in young leadership in business, and two standout personalities were there to share their thoughts and stories.

Actresses Olivia Munn and Sophia Bush, each of whom are also considered activists, were among the speakers at the Forbes Under 30 Summit in Detroit, Michigan on Sunday.

Munn, 39, was the closing keynote speaker at the Women and Wellness portion of the event, where she took the stage with Maggie McGrath, editor of ForbesWomen Magazine, who moderated.

Colorful: Actress and activist Olivia Munn was among the speakers at the Forbes Under 30 Summit in Detroit on Sunday

Olivia wore a colorful ensemble in shades of orange and red for the appearance, consisting of an orange button-down blouse and red slacks.

She wore her raven tresses down, and completed the look with some layered necklaces underneath her open collar, and nude pointy-toed Mary Janes.

Aside from her illustrious acting career, Munn is a creative strategist for on-demand dog walking app Wag!, and is credited for being an early investor in both that company as well as Uber.

On the activism front, she has in the past been a spokesperson for PETA as well as a prominent advocate for change regarding sexual harassment in Hollywood.

Partners: Actress and prolific activist Sophia Bush, right, also presented at the summit, with her friend and business partner Nia Batts (left)

Casual and colorful: Olivia wore a colorful ensemble in shades of orange and red for the appearance, featuring a button-down blouse

Additionally, the X-Men star was recently honored by the United Nation’s Girl Hero Awards for her activism.

Sophia, 37, was also a speaker at the conference, taking the stage in a stylish cream and white ensemble paired with red pumps.

In 2017, the John Tucker Must Die star founded Detroit Blows, a nontoxic blow-dry salon, with her best friend Nia Batts.

Something to say: Sophia is the co-founder of Detroit Blows, a nontoxic blow-dry salon in the area

Getting down to it: Olivia was the closing keynote speaker at the Women and Wellness portion of the event, where she took the stage with Maggie McGrath, editor of ForbesWomen (left)

Smart investor: Aside from her illustrious acting career, Munn is a creative strategist for on-demand dog walking app Wag!, and is credited for being an early investor in Uber

Bush took the stage alongside Nia and moderator Moira Forbes, Executive Vice President of Forbes Magazine, to discuss her experience starting this 'inclusive haircare space' and why she's investing in female entrepreneurs.

Sophia has been a prolific activist and advocate for a multitude of causes and charities, including education organization Pencils of Promise, charities devoted to those affected by the Deepwater Horizon oil spill, F**k Cancer, and many more.

Other speakers at the Forbes Under 30 Summit, which goes until Tuesday, include figure skater Adam Rippon, singer Normani, athlete superstar Serena Williams and Antoni Porowski of Queer Eye.

Worthy quote: Sophia shared snippets from the day on her Instagram story...
